info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 3:24PM EDT until August 1 at 12:53AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Minor flooding is occurring along Mississinewa River near Ridgeville as a result of over 2 inches of rainfall in that basin this morning. The river should fall back below flood stage later tonight.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Mississinewa River banks about one mile east of Ridgeville and in other areas begin to overflow at this level.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EDT Thursday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 100 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
